briefdescription.para: Calls the corresponding glCreate* function and assigns an ID.

simplesect.para: This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

simplesect.para: Object::unbind const

briefdescription.para: Calls the corresponding glDestroy* function and deletes the ID.

simplesect.para: This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

simplesect.para: Object::unbind const

parameterdescription.para: If this Object has not been created yet (Object::init() has not been called)

briefdescription.para: Binds this Object to be used in an OpenGL function.

simplesect.para: This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

briefdescription.para: Unbinds this Object which is equivalent to binding ID 0.

simplesect.para: This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the current ID that this Object represents.

detaileddescription.para: The ID is an unsigned number that acts like a pointer to OpenGL memory. It is assigned when Object::init() is called.
If it is 0, the Object is considered uncreated.

When using Object::bind() const it will bind to this ID. Object::unbind() const will bind to ID 0, which is the equivelant of a null pointer.
The ID represented by this Object
` Should be set in Object::init() and become 0 in Object::destroy()
